description.narrative: Output 2.3: MoE has improved capacity to develop, review and implement gender-equitable education policy, including curriculum reform and strengthened information management, to improve learning outcomes and develop life skill for employment for girls and boys, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2 - Improved Early Learning and Education: An increased proportion of children aged 0 to 18, especially girls from most disadvantaged counties, informal settlements and those affected by humanitarian crisis, access quality, gender- sensitive Early Child Development (ECD) and education services, with increased transition to secondary education.

related-activity.ref: 2400/A0/06/002 OUTCOME 2: IMPROVED EARLY LEARNING AND EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.3: MoE has improved capacity to develop, review and implement gender-equitable education policy, including curriculum reform and strengthened information management, to improve learning outcomes and develop life skill for employment for girls and boys

description.narrative: The launch of National Education Sector Strategic Plan (NESSP) 2018-2022 by the Ministry of Education provides strategic guidance for the implementation of gender equitable basic education in Kenya. UNICEF's technical support and coordination among education stakeholders ensured that the NESSP was designed as an all-inclusive, sector-wide plan that spells out policy priorities, programmes and strategies for the education sector.The educational sessional paper that provides legal framework for the implementation of the CBC, including guidance for an assessment framework, was also launched. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a national/system-level large scale assessment, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Inclusive Ed. - Existence of curricula and support from teachers and school administrators that are inclusive of children with disabilities - score (1-4), see guidance
Availability of appropriate national policy, leadership and budget for early learning and primary
Education systems are implementing a minimum package of interventions to promote learning outcomes including early learning
